content.text: Full name: Pham Xuan Lam Title: PhD
Address: R1310, 13th floor., Building A1, The National Economics University, 207 Giai Phong
Road, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi, Vietnam
Phone number: 0937638683 Email: lampx@neu.edu.vn

This course provides students with Web Programming concepts such as Web Application architecture; How to design, build and deploy a website. This course focuses on server-side technologies. So, learners are expected to have prior working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. You will learn how to implement databases, work within Server-Side environments such Java, NodeJS, PHP, .NET, Python etc., and communicate to the client side through a RESTful API.

content.text: Table 5.1. Course Learning Outcomes

cells: This course providers students the Web Programming concepts such as Web Application architecture; How to design, build and deploy a website. This course focus on server side technologies. So learners are expected to have prior working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You’ll learn how to implement databases, work within Server Side environments such Java, NodeJS, PHP, .NET, Python etc. , and communicate to the client side through a RESTful API.

column_map.Goal Description: This course providers students the Web Programming concepts such as Web Application architecture; How to design, build and deploy a website. This course focus on server side technologies. So learners are expected to have prior working knowledge of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You’ll learn how to implement databases, work within Server Side environments such Java, NodeJS, PHP, .NET, Python etc. , and communicate to the client side through a RESTful API.

cells: Enhance skills if you focus on your desired field and then improve your programming techniques, problem-solving, and analytical skills

column_map.Goal Description: Enhance skills if you focus on your desired field and then improve your programming techniques, problem-solving, and analytical skills

cells: Contributes to the development of the ability to work independently and in groups, to properly understand the responsibility for work performance and professional ethics.

column_map.Goal Description: Contributes to the development of the ability to work independently and in groups, to properly understand the responsibility for work performance and professional ethics.

content.text: Table 6.1. Course learning outcomes

cells: Understand web concepts, steps to design a website including architecture design, interface design, database design, security issues.

column_map.Description: Understand web concepts, steps to design a website including architecture design, interface design, database design, security issues.

cells: Build websites using one of the programming languages such as Nodejs, ​​C#, Java, or PHP, with the database management system

column_map.Description: Build websites using one of the programming languages such as Nodejs, ​​C#, Java, or PHP, with the database management system

cells: Use testing techniques, evaluate the quality and performance of the website

column_map.Description: Use testing techniques, evaluate the quality and performance of the website

cells: Have skills in searching, collecting, synthesizing, analyzing, and presenting to solve problems related to Web programming.

column_map.Description: Have skills in searching, collecting, synthesizing, analyzing, and presenting to solve problems related to Web programming.

cells: Have coordination skills to solve group assignments, ensure the completion of the group's work on schedule.

column_map.Description: Have coordination skills to solve group assignments, ensure the completion of the group's work on schedule.

cells: Skilled in using tools to optimize code and reduce programming time.

column_map.Description: Skilled in using tools to optimize code and reduce programming time.

cells: Able to self-study, self-study documents related to Web programming to complete assigned exercises.

column_map.Description: Able to self-study, self-study documents related to Web programming to complete assigned exercises.

cells: Consciously organize class discipline, comply with classroom rules, have a spirit of cooperation and personal responsibility for assigned activities.

content.text: Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
Students are allowed to be absent for a maximum of 30% of the class hours. Students who are absent over 30% are not qualified to take the final exam.
The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders is prohibited.
Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
Cellphones, laptops, tablets are only accepted for taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for another entertainment purpose while in class duration.

DETAILED COURSE SYLLABUS
(Decision of NEU...................., ...../...../ 2021)
Full name: Pham Xuan Lam Title: PhD
Address: R1310, 13th floor., Building A1, The National Economics University, 207 Giai Phong
Road, Hai Ba Trung District, Hanoi, Vietnam
Phone number: 0937638683 Email: lampx@neu.edu.vn
This course provides students with Web Programming concepts such as Web Application architecture; How to design, build and deploy a website. This course focuses on server-side technologies. So, learners are expected to have prior working knowledge of HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. You will learn how to implement databases, work within Server-Side environments such Java, NodeJS, PHP, .NET, Python etc., and communicate to the client side through a RESTful API.
[1] Hồ Văn Lâm (2016) Lập trình ứng dụng Web, Nhà xuất bản Xây Dựng.
[2] Casimir Saternos (2014) Client-Server Web Apps with JavaScript and Java Rich, Scalable, and RESTful
[3] David Herron (2020), Node.js Web Development: Server-side web development made easy with Node 14 using practical examples, Packt
[4] Matt Frisbie (2020) Professional JavaScript® for Web Developers
[5] Vishal Layka (2014), Learn Java for Web Development: Modern Java Web Development, Apress.
[6] Jon Duckett (2022) PHP & MySQL: Server-side Web Development, Wiley
[7] Ricardo Peres (2020) Modern Web Development with ASP.NET Core 3, Packt
[1] Visual Studio Code
[2] WebStorm

Students are required to fully take part in class lectures and activities.
Students are allowed to be absent for a maximum of 30% of the class hours. Students who are absent over 30% are not qualified to take the final exam.
The course is carried out with respect to both lecturer and students. All behavior that might adversely affect the stakeholders is prohibited.
Students need to be in class on time. Students being late for more than 10 minutes will not be eligible to take part in the session.
Cellphones, laptops, tablets are only accepted for taking notes of the lectures, preparing course assignments, not for another entertainment purpose while in class duration.
